AdminAndManagementFlows.admin_areas_and_entities: Which main areas and entities should the admin or management interfaces cover (e.g. users, content, products, orders, infrastructure, finances)?
AdminAndManagementFlows.admin_dashboard_and_navigation: How should admin dashboards and management interfaces be organized into sections and views for data, configuration, monitoring, and operations?
AdminAndManagementFlows.configuration_and_system_management: Which system-level configuration and maintenance capabilities should admins have (e.g. environment separation, file locations, job scheduling, cache/log settings, app lifecycle)?
AdminAndManagementFlows.entity_management_operations: What lifecycle and management operations should be supported for each managed entity (e.g. create, edit, approve, schedule, activate/deactivate, delete, archive)?
AdminAndManagementFlows.oversight_and_audit_controls: What oversight and control mechanisms are needed in admin flows (e.g. action auditing, safety confirmations for critical operations, environment or deployment approvals)?
AdminAndManagementFlows.permissions_and_roles: How should roles, permissions, and access scopes be structured for administrators, staff, merchants, and other actors in the management flows?
AdminAndManagementFlows.specialized_process_flows: Which specialized administrative process flows are needed for domain-specific activities (e.g. collections, consultations, maintenance tasks, testing campaigns, merchant onboarding)?

AuthenticationAndRoles.anonymous_and_pre_login_access: Which features or content should be accessible without registration or login (if any)?
AuthenticationAndRoles.cross_platform_accounts_and_sessions: Should user accounts, permissions, and sessions be shared and synchronized across different platforms or channels?
AuthenticationAndRoles.identity_and_real_name_verification: Do you need additional identity verification (e.g. real-name checks, facial recognition) and at which stages or for which actions?
AuthenticationAndRoles.login_and_authentication_methods: Which authentication methods and options should be supported for user login (e.g. password, social login, biometrics)?
AuthenticationAndRoles.registration_flow_and_requirements: What information and approval steps are required during user registration for each user type?
AuthenticationAndRoles.roles_and_permission_granularity: Which user roles are needed and how granular should permissions be across features and data?
AuthenticationAndRoles.session_and_security_management: What session and security management rules are required (e.g. persistence, timeouts, single-login limits, child-protection controls, user-managed security settings)?

CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.message_control_and_moderation: What controls over messages should be supported (e.g. blocking senders, moderation and deletion, visibility of replies)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.messaging_and_chat_capabilities: What messaging and chat capabilities are needed (e.g. internal messaging vs email, one‑to‑one or group, supported message types, call options, external app integration and sync)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.notification_channels: Which delivery channels should notifications and reminders use (e.g. email, SMS, in‑app, push, external messaging apps)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.notification_content_and_templates: What aspects of notification and message content should be configurable (e.g. fields included, language, templates, quoting of original messages)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.notification_timing_and_frequency: How should the timing and frequency of notifications and reminders be controlled (e.g. lead time before events, batching vs immediate, retry rules)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.notification_triggers_and_scope: For which events and which recipient roles should the system send notifications or reminders (e.g. transactions, tasks, inquiries, appointments)?
CommunicationAndEmailMessaging.realtime_and_reliability_behavior: What real-time delivery and reliability behavior is required for messages (e.g. live updates, store‑and‑forward, delivery and read status indicators)?

ConfigurationAndCustomization.business_rules_and_promotion_configurati: Which business rules and commercial options should be configurable (e.g. pricing schemes, discounts, loyalty points, memberships, promotions)?
ConfigurationAndCustomization.configuration_scope_and_governance: How should configuration options be scoped and governed (e.g. per user vs global, per instance vs global, grouping of settings, approvals and audit)?
ConfigurationAndCustomization.process_and_workflow_configuration: What elements of processes and workflows should be configurable (e.g. approval steps, scheduling, triggers, automation rules, standard templates)?
ConfigurationAndCustomization.system_and_integration_parameters: Which system‑level and integration parameters should be configurable via the interface (e.g. security settings, endpoints, proxies, databases, devices)?
ConfigurationAndCustomization.user_profile_and_preference_settings: Which aspects of a user's profile and personal preferences should be configurable (e.g. contact info, communication settings, tastes, usage limits)?
ConfigurationAndCustomization.visual_layout_and_theme_customization: What visual layout and theming options should be user‑configurable (e.g. page layout, component visibility, templates, colors, animations)?

DataEntryAndWorkflows.configuration_and_settings_changes: How should configuration or settings changes be performed and applied (e.g. inline and immediate, draft and review, or guided change flow with confirmation/approval)?
DataEntryAndWorkflows.crud_and_bulk_operations: For each entity, which create, read, update, delete, and bulk operations (e.g. bulk edit, bulk delete, duplicate) should be supported in the interface?
DataEntryAndWorkflows.data_entry_and_form_fields: For each key process, which data fields must users provide or be able to edit, and which of those are required vs optional?
DataEntryAndWorkflows.multi_step_workflows: Which processes should follow a defined multi-step workflow with explicit statuses or phases (e.g. submission, review, approval, publishing, completion)?
DataEntryAndWorkflows.post_result_and_error_handling: After operations produce results or errors, what follow-up options should be available to users (e.g. retry, modify and resubmit, export or download, escalate or request override)?
DataEntryAndWorkflows.triggering_and_timing_of_actions: When should key system actions run (e.g. automatically on upload or schedule, or only when manually triggered by the user)?

FileAndPlaybackHandling.cache_and_remote_content_handling: How should cached or remotely proxied files and media be handled (e.g. cache invalidation rules, retrieval order, coordination with page cache, restrictions on remote interactions)?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.file_and_media_management: Which file and media management capabilities are needed (e.g. organize, rename, delete, versioning, history, permissions, sync)?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.file_download_and_export_behavior: How should users obtain files from the system (e.g. direct download, export formats, save location choice, overwrite prompts, access restrictions)?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.file_handling_and_processing_mode: How should the system handle and process large or structured files (e.g. validation, error handling, synchronous vs background processing, integrity guarantees)?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.file_types_and_sources: Which file and media types, formats, and sources should be supported for upload, import, and use in the system?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.media_display_and_playback_controls: Which media display and playback features are required (e.g. inline vs separate viewer, zoom, fullscreen, seek, volume, speed, reading modes, streaming vs download)?
FileAndPlaybackHandling.upload_limits_and_batching: What constraints should apply to uploads (e.g. maximum size, number of files per operation, single vs multiple file upload)?

MediaEditingAndPreview.editing_granularity_and_tools: What levels of editing granularity and which editing tools should be supported for text and media content?
MediaEditingAndPreview.media_input_and_sharing: From which sources can media be added and to which destinations can it be shared from within the editing experience?
MediaEditingAndPreview.preview_interaction_and_controls: What interactive controls should previews offer for adjusting appearance, layout, or sample data?
MediaEditingAndPreview.preview_scope_and_contexts: In which contexts and outputs should users be able to preview content or data representations before finalizing?
MediaEditingAndPreview.preview_update_timing: Should previews update in real time as users edit, or only on demand when they trigger a refresh?

NavigationAndPages.browsing_and_discovery_structure: How should users browse and discover available items or content (e.g. via categories, lists, feeds, galleries, or specialized views by type)?
NavigationAndPages.core_pages_and_navigation_structure: Which main pages or sections should the product include for each user group (e.g. end users, admins, merchants), and how should users navigate between them?
NavigationAndPages.list_to_detail_navigation: Should users navigate from overviews or lists into dedicated detail views for individual items, and if so what related views should be reachable from those details?
NavigationAndPages.module_and_workspace_switching: How should users switch between major modules, workspaces, or data types (e.g. via tabs, sidebars, dropdowns, or dashboards)?
NavigationAndPages.multi_account_and_context_switching: Do you need navigation mechanisms for switching between different accounts, databases, folders, or similar contexts without fully leaving the current session?
NavigationAndPages.multi_page_management_and_hierarchy: Should users be able to create, organize, and reorder multiple pages or views within the system, and what hierarchy or grouping should these follow?
NavigationAndPages.platform_and_entry_point_navigation: How should navigation behave across different platforms or entry points (e.g. web vs apps, mini-program access paths, large-screen or kiosk modes)?

OrderingAndServiceAccess.order_and_booking_lifecycle: Which stages and transitions should exist in the lifecycle of an order or booking (e.g. draft, pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled)?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.order_and_booking_management: Which post-creation actions should users and operators be able to perform on orders or bookings (e.g. view, track status, modify, cancel, refund, reorder)?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.order_and_booking_rules: What business rules should apply to orders and bookings (e.g. prerequisites, time-slot and cancellation constraints, multi-item or multi-service inclusion, special sale/group rules)?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.ordering_and_booking_enablement: Do you need users to place orders or bookings (vs. browse-only), and if so should this use a cart, direct purchase, guest checkout, or other specific flow?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.payment_configuration_and_flow: Which payment methods, payment link or validity rules, and end-to-end payment flows do you need to support for orders, bookings, and other transactions?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.service_and_feature_access_control: Which services and interactive features should be restricted by authentication, role, or plan, and which can be used by all eligible users by default?
OrderingAndServiceAccess.service_execution_and_resource_triggerin: After an order or booking is created or paid, how should access to the underlying service or resource be handled (e.g. automatic vs manual triggers, environment/target selection, scheduling, or activation steps)?

SearchAndQuery.advanced_query_capabilities: Do you need advanced querying features such as multi-condition builders, formula or query languages, aggregations, or saved queries?
SearchAndQuery.filter_interaction_and_persistence: How should filters behave in the interface (e.g. auto-apply vs apply button, multi-select, and whether selections persist across navigation)?
SearchAndQuery.filtering_capabilities: Which filtering options and conditions should be available for narrowing lists or data sets (e.g. attributes, ranges, statuses)?
SearchAndQuery.result_presentation: How should search or query results be presented and organized (e.g. tabular view, sortable columns, pagination, quick previews)?
SearchAndQuery.search_capabilities: Do you need keyword or text-based search on lists or records, and what basic fields should be searchable?
SearchAndQuery.search_scope_and_fields: Should users be able to control the scope and fields of search (e.g. which collections or folders are searched by default or by choice)?
SearchAndQuery.sorting_capabilities: Should users be able to sort result lists, and by which fields and sort orders?

UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.content_interaction_and_engagement: Which interaction options should be available on content and posts (e.g. likes, comments, ratings, shares, saves, polls)?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.direct_communication_and_messaging: What forms of communication should be supported between users or between users and the organization (e.g. private messaging, group chat, real-time chat, Q&A boards)?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.moderation_and_history_controls: What moderation and history controls are required for user-generated content and messages (e.g. reporting, blocking, removal, visibility and deletion of history)?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.ownership_and_group_management: What ownership and management capabilities should content or channel creators and group admins have (e.g. renaming, deleting, membership control, publishing permissions)?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.social_relationships_and_following: What types of social relationship features are needed (e.g. friend requests, follow/unfollow, special prompts or actions after following)?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.ugc_creation_and_submission: What types of user-generated content should users be able to create or submit, and what information should each submission include?
UserGeneratedContentAndCommunity.ugc_structure_and_organization: How should user-generated content and community discussions be structured and organized (e.g. forums, channels, topics, tags, per-item threads)?

AnalyticsAndVisualization.breakdowns_filters_and_granularity: Which breakdown dimensions and controls are needed for analytics (e.g. filters, segments, comparison periods, and data granularity levels)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.data_analysis_capabilities: What levels and types of data analysis should be supported (e.g. aggregations, time‑series, segmentation, forecasting, anomaly detection)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.metrics_and_indicators_scope: Which key metrics and statistical indicators should analytics and dashboards track and display (e.g. KPIs, performance measures, rankings)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.realtime_and_alerting_behavior: How should real‑time monitoring and alerting work in analytics views (e.g. refresh frequency, auto‑updates, alert rules, dedicated alert dashboards)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.reporting_and_export_capabilities: What reporting features are needed (e.g. configurable layouts, scheduled reports, export formats, email delivery)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.visual_interactivity_and_drilldown: What interactive behaviors should visualizations provide (e.g. tooltips, zooming, series toggling, drill‑down into detailed views, multi‑dataset views)?
AnalyticsAndVisualization.visualization_types_and_formats: Which visualization formats should be supported for analytics (e.g. tables, charts, maps, heatmaps, dashboards, large‑screen views)?

DocumentationAndGuides.developer_documentation_scope: Which topics should developer-facing documentation cover (e.g. quick start, API reference, integration guides, best practices)?
DocumentationAndGuides.documentation_access_and_placement: How should users access documentation within the product (e.g. dedicated docs area, contextual in-page help, searchable documentation)?
DocumentationAndGuides.documentation_localization: In which languages should the documentation be available?
DocumentationAndGuides.documentation_scope: Which types of documentation content are needed for the product and its services (e.g. feature overviews, release notes, FAQs, service explanations)?
DocumentationAndGuides.documentation_structure: How should documentation be organized into sections and hierarchies (e.g. getting started, installation, usage by module, troubleshooting)?

DomainDataElements.categorization_and_grouping_structure: How should entities and records be organized via categories, tags, folders, labels, or similar grouping mechanisms?
DomainDataElements.core_entities_to_model: Which core domain entities and their relationships should be represented in the system data model (e.g. main business objects, resources, and links between them)?
DomainDataElements.data_schema_and_table_standards: What standards and constraints should apply to data schemas and tables (e.g. required system fields, data types, keys, and indexing metadata)?
DomainDataElements.data_scope_and_accessible_sources: Which data sources, collections, tables, or datasets should be in scope for browsing, extraction, and configuration in the system?
DomainDataElements.entity_attribute_definitions: Which key attributes or fields must be stored for each core entity type (e.g. identifiers, descriptive fields, status, configuration parameters)?
DomainDataElements.record_detail_fields_to_display: Which specific fields from each entity should be shown in user-facing views for summaries and detailed pages?
DomainDataElements.specialized_metadata_and_parameters: Which specialized metadata fields or domain-specific parameters (e.g. engineering quantities, risk factors, scoring rules) are required for relevant entities?

FileAndMediaContent.content_libraries_and_reuse: Do you need centralized libraries for organizing, versioning, and reusing files or media across different pages, templates, or operations?
FileAndMediaContent.content_thematic_and_scope_rules: Are there specific thematic focuses or scope rules for content and any classification requirements (e.g. topics, age restrictions, or domain-specific groupings)?
FileAndMediaContent.content_types_and_formats: Which types and formats of files or media should be supported and distinguishable in the system (e.g. documents, images, videos, audio, streams, remote content)?
FileAndMediaContent.downloadable_and_exportable_assets: Which files or media should be directly downloadable or exportable by users (e.g. application packages, resource bundles, documents, data exports)?
FileAndMediaContent.file_and_media_metadata: What metadata should be stored and exposed for files or media items (e.g. name, type, size, creator, categories, tags, versions)?
FileAndMediaContent.media_presentation_and_layout: How should files and media be presented in the interface (e.g. lists vs thumbnails, galleries, embedded in text, zoom/swipe or other interactions)?
FileAndMediaContent.media_quality_and_specifications: What quality standards and technical specifications should apply to media files (e.g. resolution targets, aspect ratios, compression, maximum size, preferred formats)?

InformationArchitecture.access_visibility_structure: Which content should be publicly visible and which should require authenticated or restricted access?
InformationArchitecture.content_grouping_and_categorization: How should content items be grouped or categorized so they are easy to browse and find (e.g. by type, audience, topic, or use case)?
InformationArchitecture.page_and_section_hierarchy: What overall hierarchy of pages and sections should structure the site or application (e.g. main hubs, child pages, and sub-sections)?
InformationArchitecture.role_and_audience_based_structure: Should the information architecture differentiate content views by user role or audience segment, or use shared pages with contextual differences?
InformationArchitecture.within_page_information_layout: How should information be ordered and arranged within a page or detail view (e.g. titles, introductions, key fields, and supporting content)?

RecordsAndOutcomes.audit_trails_and_change_history: Do you need audit trails or version history for configuration and data changes, and what details about changes (who, what, when) should be captured and reviewable?
RecordsAndOutcomes.data_retention_and_archiving: For how long should different categories of records be retained, and do you need limits, deletion rules, or archiving policies?
RecordsAndOutcomes.history_visibility_and_access: Who should be able to view historical records and how should they access and navigate them (e.g. user views, admin views, filters, exports)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.record_field_detail_level: What information fields and status indicators should be stored and displayed for each record type (e.g. timestamps, participants, amounts, outcomes, metadata)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.record_types_and_scope: Which types of events, transactions, and business records should the system store and track over time (e.g. operations, orders, applications, learning, financial, inspections)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.result_and_performance_records: Should the system keep historical records of process outcomes and performance metrics (e.g. executions, experiments, reports, portfolio metrics) for comparison and review?

TemplatesAndOptions.built_in_templates: Which kinds of built-in reusable templates or presets do you need for common artifacts and workflows (e.g. documents, reports, pages, campaigns, rules, checklists, queries, visualizations)?
TemplatesAndOptions.starter_and_sample_assets: Do you need starter or sample assets (e.g. sample projects, example configurations, sample code, default templates) that users can copy or build on?
TemplatesAndOptions.template_dynamic_fields: Should templates support dynamic fields or placeholders that are populated automatically with context-specific data?
TemplatesAndOptions.template_organization_and_access: How should templates be organized and controlled (e.g. categories, tags, template types, library scope, and role-based access restrictions)?
TemplatesAndOptions.template_version_management: Do you need version history and rollback for templates so users can review and restore previous versions?
TemplatesAndOptions.user_defined_templates: Should users be able to create, save, and reuse their own custom templates or configurations?

ColorSchemeAndComponents.accent_and_highlight_colors: Which colors should be used for accents and highlights on interactive or emphasized elements (e.g. links, active states, badges, focus outlines)?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.color_contrast_and_accessibility: Are there specific contrast, readability, or accessibility requirements that the color scheme must satisfy across backgrounds and components?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.component_base_colors: Which colors should be used as the primary backgrounds or fills for key UI components (e.g. buttons, cards, panels, navigation bars)?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.cross_interface_style_consistency: Which visual elements (e.g. colors, typography, spacing, component styles) should be standardized to ensure consistent appearance across pages and device types?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.layout_background_colors: Which colors should be used for overall page and layout backgrounds, and should they apply globally or only to specific sections?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.state_color_system: Do you need a defined set of colors for component states (e.g. hover, active, disabled, success, error), and should they be derived from the primary or accent colors?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.theme_and_brand_alignment: Should additional colors, variations, or decorative elements be introduced to better align the interface with the overall brand or thematic concept?
